page.title: 20AN OUTSIDER'S VIEW
page.content: Before I came to St. Bedes I had not seen Lawrence Weston. Now I come up {Long Cross}(the main road) every morning, so I can see the{houses and {schools.}Compared to Clevedon, where I live, the houses seem very close together and they are mostly built by the{Council.}There are also{flats, some of them six or seven storeys high. I also notice that there is a lot of{litter}around the shopping area and many of the walls have writing on them. Some people who live in Clevedon still think of Lawrence Weston as quite a tough area. However it has got nearby{parks and woods}at Blaise Castle and it has got lots of open {fields}for games. Lawrence Weston people are usually friendly and say that there is less trouble today than a few years ago. St. Bedes School
